intro: Schwartzia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican schwartzia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forests and thrives in shaded environments. Its wood is valued for its durability and is used in local craftsmanship. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
